metadata.Title: CVE-2019-10184 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
undertow before version 2.0.23.Final is vulnerable to an information leak issue. Web apps may have their directory structures predicted through requests without trailing slashes via the api.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-10184` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libundertow-java - 2.0.23-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: undertow package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.23-1').
